intro: Daniellia klainei, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by round, fleshy fruits containing black seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
